column4: I'm running Feisty Fawn and can't see my external HDD, any tips?
can't remember, but it is the one I used to back up my old Ubuntu install before formatting and starting from scratch
does it show up when you type 'sudo fdisk -l'?
I *think* I see it after fdisk -l
it is marked as /dev/sda1 and is Fat32
when you type 'mount', you do not see it listed, correct?
nope, it is not there when I type mount
alright, try to mount it.  Are you familiar with using mount on the command line?
I haven't used mount from the command line in a while, I'm assuming sudo mount /dev/sda1 /some/mountpoint
right, make sure you create /some/mountpoint first, then: sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sda1 /some/mountpoint   .  If that works, you'll probably want to tweak the permissions and/or add it to fstab
thanks, that worked great, I can at least read data from it (which is all I want to do today)
any ideas why it doesn't automount like it used to?
no, I'm not sure.  Do other drives automount at the moment?
I actually don't have any other with me... but they did when I first installed Feisty Fawn....
could it be because I modified fstab at one point?
check that gnome-volume-manager is running, check that it doesn't have "noauto" in your fstab for your drive
gvm is running, and the cdrom is the only place I see "noauto"
